summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 4, 2019. The sheets are routine logs for observing inmates in locked-down status, requiring staff to document checks at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it represents the type of institutional record-keeping in place at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Routine inmate observation checks
events.description: Staff at MCC New York's Special Housing Unit conducted and documented 30-minute observation checks on inmates in continuous locked-down status, as per standard procedure.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York dated August 4, 2019.
It details a standard procedure requiring staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The logs are signed off by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, indicating a chain of review.
The document itself contains no specific references to Jeffrey Epstein, other inmates, or any notable events beyond routine checks.
The format includes multiple tiers (G, H, L, M, J, K) suggesting observation logs for different cell blocks or sections within the SHU.
